host-utils

00001 /*! \file host-utils 
00002     \brief This file is not part of the driver sources.  The contents of this file are used in HTML document generation.
00003 */
00004 
00005  /*! \page util-main OCTEON PCI Host utilities
00006 
00007     The PCI base driver package includes utilities that can be run on the
00008    host system to get status information and to load binary images to OCTEON.
00009    The sources can be found at OCTEON-SDK/components/driver/host/utils.
00010    The user api library must be created before the utlities can be compiled.
00011 
00012    To compile the user-space API, you can
00013     \li do a "make host_api"  at OCTEON-SDK/components/driver OR
00014     \li do "make"  at OCTEON-SDK/components/driver/host/api
00015 
00016    To compile the utility sources, you can
00017     \li  do a "make utils" at OCTEON-SDK/components/driver  OR
00018     \li  do "make" at OCTEON-SDK/components/driver/host/utils
00019 
00020 <br><br>
00021    <b>1. oct_dbg (OCTEON debug utility) </b>
00022 
00023     <b>oct_dbg</b> is a menu driven utility that allows the user to 
00024    reset the OCTEON device (without unloading the driver) and to read or
00025    write OCTEON registers and core memory locations. This utility requires
00026    the OCTEON user-space API library. <b>oct_dbg</b> can read the PCI config
00027    space registers, registers mapped to BAR0 and windowed NPI registers. It
00028    can also read or write OCTEON core memory locations using BAR1 mappings.
00029 
00030    Command line options:
00031    \li <OCTEON_id> - OCTEON device id (0 for the first OCTEON device). The
00032        utility prompts for device id if it finds multiple OCTEONs in the system
00033        and a device id was not passed on the command line.
00034 
00035    Menu Options:
00036       Significant options include 't' to reset OCTEON, 'r' to read OCTEON
00037       BAR0 registers, 'R' to read OCTEON config registers. 
00038 
00039 <br><br>
00040    <b>2. oct_stats (OCTEON statistics display utility) </b>
00041 
00042     <b>oct_stats</b> allows the user to check on the input, output and DMA queue
00043     statistics for packet count and byte count. It also displays 10-second
00044     average byte count for input and output queues. It has options to
00045     display the driver buffer pool usage. The utility can be used to display
00046     statistics once or at user-defined intervals. "oct_stats -h" displays 
00047     information about usage and available options. The OCTEON id is always
00048     required. If no other options are given, <b>oct_stats</b> will print
00049     statistics for the input and output queue refreshed at 1 second interval
00050 
00051     Command line options:
00052     \li <OCTEON_id> - OCTEON device id (0 for the first OCTEON device) [ required ]
00053     \li <interval>  - refresh the statistics at this interval (in seconds) [ optional ]
00054     \li -i : display input  queue statistics [optional]
00055     \li -o : display output queue statistics [optional]
00056     \li -c : display DMA    queue statistics [optional]
00057     \li -d : display Direct Data queue statistics [optional]
00058     \li -b : display buffer pool statistics [optional]
00059     \li -a : display statistics for all queues [optional]
00060     \li -r : refresh statistics at regular intervals [optional]
00061     \li -v : verbose output [optional]
00062     \li -h : print usage messages  
00063 
00064 */
